events.name: Lithium Nickel Manganese Cobalt Oxides (NMC)
events.wd_description: Lithium nickel manganese cobalt oxides (NMC) are mixed metal oxides used as the positively charged cathode in lithium-ion batteries for mobile devices and electric vehicles. NMC is notable for its high energy density, operating voltage, and efforts to reduce cobalt content due to ethical and cost concerns.
events.description: Lithium nickel manganese cobalt oxides (NMC) are mixed metal oxides used as the positively charged cathode in lithium-ion batteries for mobile devices and electric vehicles. NMC is notable for its high energy density, operating voltage, and efforts to reduce cobalt content due to ethical and cost concerns.

events.name: Structure and Formula
events.wd_description: NMC materials are mixed metal oxides of lithium, nickel, manganese, and cobalt with the general formula LiNixMnyCo1-x-yO2.
events.description: Lithium nickel manganese cobalt oxides (NMC) have the general formula LiNixMnyCo1-x-yO2, where the specific ratios of nickel, manganese, and cobalt can be adjusted to optimize battery performance for various applications.

events.name: Optimization for EVs
events.wd_description: There is a focus on optimizing NMC for electric vehicle applications due to its high energy density and operating voltage. Efforts are being made to reduce the cobalt content in NMC because of ethical mining issues and high costs, while increasing nickel content to provide more capacity.
events.description: There is a focus on optimizing NMC for electric vehicle applications due to its high energy density and operating voltage. Efforts are being made to reduce the cobalt content in NMC because of ethical mining issues and high costs, while increasing nickel content to provide more capacity.

events.name: Usage in Electric Vehicles
events.wd_description: Many electric cars use NMC cathode batteries. Examples include the BMW ActiveE and BMW i8. Tesla, however, uses nickel cobalt aluminum oxide and lithium iron phosphate batteries for their vehicles. Tesla's home storage product, the Powerwall, uses NMC to increase the number of charge/discharge cycles over its lifetime.
events.description: Many electric cars use NMC cathode batteries. Examples include the BMW ActiveE and BMW i8. Tesla, however, uses nickel cobalt aluminum oxide and lithium iron phosphate batteries for their vehicles. Tesla's home storage product, the Powerwall, uses NMC to increase the number of charge/discharge cycles over its lifetime.

events.name: BMW ActiveE
events.wd_description: The BMW ActiveE, launched in 2011, uses NMC cathode batteries.
events.description: The BMW ActiveE, launched in 2011, uses NMC cathode batteries.

events.name: BMW i8
events.wd_description: The BMW i8, starting from 2013, also uses NMC cathode batteries.
events.description: The BMW i8, starting from 2013, also uses NMC cathode batteries.

events.name: Tesla Powerwall
events.wd_description: The Tesla Powerwall, a home storage unit, uses NMC batteries to increase the number of charge/discharge cycles over its lifespan.
events.description: The Tesla Powerwall, a home storage unit, uses NMC batteries to increase the number of charge/discharge cycles over its lifespan.

events.name: Nickel Cobalt Aluminium Oxide
events.description: NCA batteries are used by Tesla in their electric vehicles due to their high energy density and stability. These batteries contain nickel, cobalt, and aluminum as their primary components and are known for their high performance and long life span, making them suitable for the high demands of electric vehicles.

events.name: Lithium Iron Phosphate
events.description: LFP batteries are another type of battery used by Tesla, particularly valued for their safety and longevity. These batteries contain lithium, iron, and phosphate, offering a lower energy density compared to NCA batteries but with a longer cycle life and better thermal stability, making them a preferred choice for certain Tesla models and applications.
